instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.PM_PCH_SYS_PWOK: What is PM_PCH_SYS_PWOK? This is a typo of PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK When you see PM_PCH_SYS_PWOK, assume they meant to type PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK.

threads.title: 3476 VCORE=1.7V No USB light/activity, no display
threads.message:
When connecting to external the monitor seems to detect something but then says no HDMI connection - so seems as though some sign of signal from HDMI connector but definitely not booting. NO chime. THis does SMC reset. Hard to tell if it is PRAM resetting. 
Turning on:
Power button, 2 seconds later = fan spin, about 12 seconds after power-up fan pauses for about 3 seconds, then spins again for about 10 seconds and pauses for 3 and repeats.

Reflash the firmware?

threads.title: 3476 VCORE=1.7V No USB light/activity, no display
threads.message:
New BIOS is an option.

Do you get <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> at least?

threads.title: 3476 VCORE=1.7V No USB light/activity, no display
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0
I did reflash the BIOS w clean me

threads.title: 3476 VCORE=1.7V No USB light/activity, no display
threads.message:
With <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> low, power on sequence is not completed.
What about <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWOK</SIGNAL>?
Also check <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 3476 VCORE=1.7V No USB light/activity, no display
3476 VCORE=1.7V No USB light/activity, no display
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
Remove <CHIP>U2071</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R2071</RESISTOR>/81 and check if still low voltage.
If yes, you may have a PCH issue.

3476 VCORE=1.7V No USB light/activity, no display
threads.message: It should be 1V aprox; board turns off, when you measure there?

threads.title: 3476 VCORE=1.7V No USB light/activity, no display
threads.message: Actually yes, board shuts off when I measure there.

threads.title: 3476 VCORE=1.7V No USB light/activity, no display
3476 VCORE=1.7V No USB light/activity, no display
threads.message: I hadn't noticed that behaviour before but indeed when measuring <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL> on a 3476 board will often turn off after removing the probe (and sometimes when measuring). Not sure why and if it's an indication of anything. I can still often measure 1.05V when touching with the probe initially.
